risk_description: Data consistency and synchronization failures in the 'Offline-First' mobile architecture using WatermelonDB/Realm, specifically regarding service request queueing and conflict resolution during network restoration.
affected_tasks: WI-MOBILE-003 (Implement Offline Queue), US-075 (User Offline Actions)
root_cause: Complexity of bi-directional synchronization and conflict resolution strategies when multiple devices modify the same dataset or when backend state changes while client is offline.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a 'Last-Write-Wins' conflict resolution policy initially; Utilize a robust sync adapter for WatermelonDB; Enforce strict idempotent API design for all write endpoints (POST/PUT/PATCH).
contingency_plan: Fallback to 'Online-Only' mode for critical write operations if sync integrity cannot be guaranteed, queuing only read operations.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate exceeding 1% in staging environment telemetry.

risk_description: Delays in configuring Azure AD B2C Custom Policies for complex requirements (MFA, role claims injection, mobile biometric integration) impacting the critical path for user authentication.
root_cause: Steep learning curve of Azure AD B2C Identity Experience Framework (XML configuration) and potential limitations in standard user flows requiring custom development.
mitigation_strategy: Assign a dedicated Identity Specialist; Start B2C configuration immediately (Sprint 0); Utilize standard user flows for MVP if custom policies prove too time-consuming.
contingency_plan: Revert to standard OIDC flows without custom claims injection and fetch user profile/roles from the internal database post-login as a temporary workaround.
monitoring_trigger: Failure to complete 'Sign-up/Sign-in' proof of concept by end of Sprint 1.

risk_description: Technician location updates via WebSockets failing to meet the <2s latency requirement due to network variability, Redis adapter bottlenecks, or mobile background process throttling.
root_cause: Aggressive OS-level battery optimization killing background location threads on iOS/Android and latency introduced by the Pub/Sub hop through Redis.
mitigation_strategy: Implement client-side throttling (e.g., send updates every 5s instead of 1s); Use `react-native-background-geolocation` with motion-detection to keep service alive; Optimize Redis adapter configuration.
contingency_plan: Increase latency tolerance in SLA to 5-10 seconds; Implement 'polling' fallback if WebSocket connection is unstable.
monitoring_trigger: P95 latency metrics for `LocationUpdate` events exceeding 1.5s during load testing.

risk_description: Cost overruns and rate limiting from third-party APIs (Mapbox for geocoding/routing, Azure AI Document Intelligence for OCR) under high load or denial-of-service conditions.
root_cause: Direct synchronous calls to paid external APIs triggered by user actions without sufficient caching or rate limiting protection.
mitigation_strategy: Implement aggressive caching for Geocoding results; Use a Circuit Breaker pattern (Polly/Opossum) for all external calls; Set strict budget alerts in Azure Cost Management.
contingency_plan: Disable OCR 'auto-fill' feature temporarily if quota is exceeded; Fallback to basic postal code matching instead of polygon geocoding.
monitoring_trigger: API usage costs exceeding 80% of monthly budget projection within the first week.

risk_description: Distributed transaction failures causing data inconsistency between the Primary Database, Audit Logs (OpenSearch), and Notification Service (Service Bus) during critical state changes.
affected_tasks: WI-CORE-001 (Service Request State Machine), WI-INT-002 (Audit Logging)
root_cause: Lack of two-phase commit or transactional outbox pattern when coordinating writes across PostgreSQL and Azure Service Bus/OpenSearch.
mitigation_strategy: Implement the 'Transactional Outbox' pattern: write events to a local DB table within the business transaction, then use a separate worker to push to Service Bus/OpenSearch.
contingency_plan: Implement comprehensive reconciliation scripts to identify and fix orphaned or missing audit logs/notifications.
monitoring_trigger: Discrepancy count between 'ServiceRequests' table and 'AuditLogs' index > 0.

risk_description: Complexity of 'Right to be Forgotten' (GDPR) implementation across distributed storage (Postgres, Blob Storage, OpenSearch logs) leading to compliance violations.
root_cause: Immutable nature of Audit Logs and decentralized storage of PII (Invoices in Blob, User data in B2C/Postgres) making complete erasure difficult.
mitigation_strategy: Design PII data mapping early; Implement a 'Crypto-shredding' strategy where PII is encrypted with a user-specific key that can be deleted; Ensure Audit Logs store references, not raw PII.
contingency_plan: Manual intervention process for GDPR deletion requests while automation is being refined.

risk_description: Failure to meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility standards in complex interactive components (Maps, Signature Pads, Real-time Chat) delaying release.
root_cause: Canvas-based elements (Signature Pad) and Map controls are inherently difficult to make accessible to screen readers; Late stage accessibility testing.
mitigation_strategy: Adopt 'Accessibility-First' development; Integrate `axe-core` into CI/CD pipelines (WI-CICD-001); Use native accessible alternatives where canvas isn't strictly necessary.
contingency_plan: Provide alternative text-based workflows for map/signature interactions (e.g., text confirmation instead of signature for accessibility mode).
monitoring_trigger: Automated accessibility score < 90% in CI builds.
